main_definition: A trademark is a legally registered symbol, name, or phrase that distinguishes products or services of one company from those of others.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To distinctly mark a product with a unique identifier
meanings_and_examples.example: The company trademarked their new logo and brand name.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A symbol, word, or phrase legally protected to represent a particular company or product
meanings_and_examples.example: Pepsi's red and white checkmark is one of the most recognizable trademarks in the world.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To register as a trademark with the appropriate authority, such as the United States Patent and Trademark Office
meanings_and_examples.example: The company submitted their application to register their new logo as a trademark.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An intellectual property right that provides exclusive ownership of certain commercial uses of words or designs by an individual or organization
meanings_and_examples.example: The copyright, patent, and trademarks are all forms of intellectual property rights that protect a creator's work.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A unique feature or characteristic used to identify products from competitors in the marketplace
meanings_and_examples.example: Nike’s swoosh logo is instantly recognizable and serves as one of their key trademarks.
